alert.note: Alert for Breckinridge; Hancock (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 28 at 9:39AM EST until March 05 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Indiana...Kentucky... Ohio River at Cannelton Lock affecting Hancock, Perry, Crawford and Breckinridge Counties. .Heavy rain from the past week will continue to cause the river to run high. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Ohio River at Cannelton Lock. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 39.0 feet, Highway 66 floods near Derby - Dexter area. At 42.0 feet, Agricultural flooding begins near Cloverport and Cannelton. Highway 66 floods near Derby and Dexter. Rocky Point Girl Scout camp is affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EST Monday /6:00 AM CST Monday/ the stage was 41.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 41.8 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Action stage is 40.0 feet. - Flood stage is 42.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding is possible and rivers are forecast to exceed bankfull. If you are in the advisory area remain alert to possible flooding, or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued by late Tuesday morning.
